root.title: Inscription “Tes”
root.history: The stele was made in period of ruling of Eletmish Bilge kagan in 747-759.
root.names: “The Tesyin monument”, “The first monument of Tur-ayn Eletmish Bilge kagan”
root.place: The stele was found in Avdrantyn hendyi district on left coast of Tes river inagaan Uul sum of Khövsgöl aimag of Mongolia.
root.store: It is kept in the laboratory warehouse of Mongolian Archeology institute.
root.general: The stele is made from granite of dark-chestnut color.
root.description: There are 22 lines of inscription. The most part of the inscription is invisible now.
root.size: Length – 0.85 m, width – 0.35 m, and thickness – 0.22 m
root.investigation: The stele is found by S.G.Klyashtornyi, S.Karzhaubai, A.Ochir, the members of Soviet-Mongolian joint historical and cultural expedition in 1976 219. S.Karzhaubay 220, S.G.Klyashtornyi 221 and M.Shinehuu 222 published the first researches of the inscription. The Mongolian-Japanese joint expedition conducted detailed research of the stele in 1996-1997 223. Kazakh scientists conducted researches in 2004.
root.details: Н.Базылхан "Көне түрік бітіктастары мен ескерткіштері (Орхон, Ениесей, Талас)" //"Қазақстан тарихы түркі тілді деректемелерде" атты сериясы бойынша. II том. - Алматы: Дайк-пресс, 2005. - Б.146-148.
